items: Start by lying flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides.
Bend your knees and bring them up towards your chest.
Slowly lower both knees to one side, keeping your shoulders flat on the ground.
Hold the stretch for 10-15 seconds, feeling the stretch in your lower back and hips.
Slowly bring your knees back up to center and repeat on the other side.
Repeat the stretch 2-3 times on each side.
Improves flexibility in the hips and lower back
Relieves tension and tightness in the muscles surrounding the hips and lower back
Can help alleviate lower back pain
Stretches the inner thighs and groin muscles
Can improve posture and alignment of the spine
